primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The risen Jesus penetrates the fearful, self-enclosed space of the church to unilaterally establish a new reality through four magisterial assertions.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus came and stood among them
Jesus brings the reality of what he says
a new order that comes along with the power of Jesus

zender.identificatie: The Father / The Large Heart of God
tekstueel_bewijs: As the Father has sent me
Forgiveness must come from the large heart of God

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of the magisterial word.

tekstueel_bewijs: the intruding, invasive, energizing power from God
helper.rol_van_god: God (as Jesus) is the Subject; the Spirit is the endowment of power.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that becomes an indwelling power to move the subject beyond themselves.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad mood but 'the gates of hell' and 'cycles of death' that the world cannot break on its own.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The sent church engaging in the mission of forgiveness and neighbor-love.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church/Disciples
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (mission) is explicitly fueled by the primary program (Jesus' arrival and the gift of the Spirit).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → New Life/Forgiveness → The Fearful Church

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus came and disrupted their safe hiding.
The Jesus who says the word brings the reality of what he says.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The people of Jesus shut behind closed doors.
We cannot pretend they were not said.
You must accept the sending of Jesus.

voorbeelden: you must accept the sending of Jesus
churches that want to start again
power from God that comes like the wind to blow us beyond ourselves

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the endowment of power (Pouvoir) to a subject that is otherwise paralyzed by fear (lack of Pouvoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Fear/Shut doors) through ~S2 (Jesus disrupting the hiding) to S1 (New Life/Peace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the sovereign entry of Christ, which 'nullifies' the threats of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and fear are described as 'vicious cycles' that cannot be broken from within.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Jesus is the primary actor who creates the conditions for human response.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If you want the peace of Jesus, then you must accept the sending of Jesus.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus takes over the meeting. He dominates the room.
The church has never gone anywhere important under its own steam.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The disciples are not models to follow but cowering recipients of grace.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God saves the fearful.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; the burden of 'starting' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic start to the Christian life.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the primary program (receiving peace/Spirit) to the secondary (mission/forgiveness) is logically and theologically tight.
spanning_punten: The 'if/then' statement regarding peace and sending creates a slight legalistic tension in an otherwise grace-heavy text.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has stood against death and now governs... nullifies all the would-be threats.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability) given to the incompetent subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'vicious cycle' and 'death' that requires a 'gate-crasher' to break.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Jesus as the Subject of the primary verbs of salvation and transformation.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the hearer's position as the one 'visited' and 'surprised'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this; it is theologically appropriate for Pentecost.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'must' of the mission is always framed as a 'can' because of the Spirit.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining the divine initiative while calling for human response.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'gate-crasher' metaphor, Greimas shows that Jesus functions as the Subject who re-modalizes the Receiver from 'unable' to 'able'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Greek 'Eirene'; Greimas focuses on how 'Peace' actantially functions as a 'word of assault' against the Opponent.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch' where Jesus takes over the room, displacing the fearful disciples as the center of action.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'exemplarist trap' by making the disciples' fear the starting point for God's action rather than a hurdle the disciples must first overcome.
